intro: Eriogonum vimineum var. restioides, commonly known as the restio-like eriogonum, is a flowering plant species native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
